pullRequest.title: DDF-UI-135 filter blank attributes from CSV export result
pullRequest.bodyText:
Backend portion of the Forward port of #5931

What does this PR do?
This PR fixes the single result export so that only the attributes that exist on that particular record will show up as columns in the .csv
Who is reviewing it?

@hayleynorton @andrewzimmer @zta6
Select relevant component teams:

@codice/ui
Ask 2 committers to review/merge the PR and tag them here.
@bdeining

How should this be tested?


build/install
add some records
search for records and click the ellipsis menu on the bottom right corner of the result
select "Export as"
choose csv and download
verify that the blank attributes are filtered out

Any background context you want to provide?
What are the relevant tickets?
Fixes: codice/ddf-ui#135
Screenshots

Checklist:

 Documentation Updated
 Update / Add Threat Dragon models
 Update / Add Unit Tests
 Update / Add Integration Tests

Notes on Review Process
Please see Notes on Review Process for further guidance on requirements for merging and abbreviated reviews.
Review Comment Legend:

✏️ (Pencil) This comment is a nitpick or style suggestion, no action required for approval. This comment should provide a suggestion either as an in line code snippet or a gist.
❓ (Question Mark) This comment is to gain a clearer understanding of design or code choices, clarification is required but action may not be necessary for approval.
❗ (Exclamation Mark) This comment is critical and requires clarification or action before approval.

nodes.bodyText:
columnOrder is defined in a constant here

  
    
      ddf/catalog/transformer/catalog-transformer-csv-queryresponse/src/main/java/ddf/catalog/transformer/csv/CsvQueryResponseTransformer.java
    
    
         Line 46
      in
      b054ac2
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public static final String COLUMN_ORDER_KEY = "columnOrder";

Something to consider is using the columnOrder constant here as well in case the constant value ever changed (however maybe unlikely). I wouldn't hold up the PR for it. Would the test just fail in that case?

commit.message: DDF-UI-135 pass attributes to the csv transformer
DDF-UI-135 only filter if columnOrder is provided
DDF-UI-135 use List instead of ArrayList
DDF-UI-135 use CollectionUtils and import List
DDF-UI-135 use defined constant for columnOrder

beforeCommit.message: DDF-UI-135 use defined constant for columnOrder
